caption: Harry Potter" creator J.K. Rowling revealed that lead film actor Daniel Radcliffe is Chinese.

result.explanation: The image shows Daniel Radcliffe, but the caption falsely claims J.K. Rowling revealed that he is Chinese.  There is no visual evidence to support that claim, and it's factually incorrect.

candidates.title: 'Harry Potter' Author JK Rowling Reveals Daniel Radcliffe Is Chinese?
candidates.content:
Claim:
"Harry Potter" creator J.K. Rowling revealed that lead film actor Daniel Radcliffe is Chinese.
Rating:
False
About this rating
On 6 January 2017, the satirical web site ClickHole, an offshoot of The Onion created to mock clickbait and viral content, posted a story reporting that the author and creator of the widely popular Harry Potter series had revealed that Daniel Radcliffe, the actor who portrayed the boy wizard in film versions of her books, is not English but Chinese:
Ever since releasing the final book in her beloved series, J.K. Rowling has been known to reveal some shocking secrets from inside the Potter universe. Whether its a characters hidden past, a plot point we may have missed, or a look inside what our favorite witches and wizards are doing today, Rowling has proven time and time again that theres still plenty we dont know about the magical world of Hogwarts. But the authors latest bombshell really takes the cake: J.K. Rowling just announced that Daniel Radcliffe is Chinese.
Whoa. Mind = blown!
As proof, the web site included a series of fake tweets by Rowling, allegedly made on 6 January 2017:
The tweets don't appear on the author's authentic Twitter timeline, and according to available biographical information, Radcliffe was born in London, and neither of his parents is of Chinese descent.
ClickHole, like its sister site The Onion, is an openly satirical web site. Here's how ClickHole describes their content on the site's "About us" page:
Lets be honest: Today, the average website carelessly churns out hundreds of pieces of pandering, misleading content, most of which tragically fall short of going viral.
At ClickHole, we refuse to stand for this. We strive to make sure that all of our content panders to and misleads our readers just enough to make it go viral. You see, we dont think anything on the internet should ever have to settle for mere tens of thousands of pageviews. We believe that each and every article  whether about pop culture, politics, internet trends, or social justice  should be clicked on and shared by hundreds of millions of internet users before they can even comprehend what they just read.
ClickHole has one and only one core belief: All web content deserves to go viral.
Some of the headlines on ClickHole's front page as of 6 January 2017 included "Passing The Torch: Watch This Father Give His Daughter His Panini Before Walking Into the Forest Forever" and "One Day I Will Understand Basketball (by Jack Nicholson)."
candidates.description: The claim that J.K. Rowling said "Harry Potter" actor Daniel Radcliffe is of Chinese heritage originated with the satirical web site ClickHole.

result.explanation: The claim that J.K. Rowling revealed Daniel Radcliffe is Chinese is explicitly labeled as false by Snopes.  Snopes cites ClickHole, a satirical website known for its false and misleading content, as the origin of this claim.  The Snopes article also points out that Radcliffe's biography does not support this claim.
result.supporting_points:
- Snopes rates the claim as False
- Snopes identifies ClickHole (a satirical website) as the source of the claim
- Snopes notes that Radcliffe's biography shows he was born in London and has no Chinese heritage

final_result.explanation:
The claim that J.K. Rowling revealed Daniel Radcliffe is Chinese is demonstrably false based on both internal and external evidence.  The internal check correctly identifies the image as Daniel Radcliffe, but the caption's claim about his ethnicity is unsubstantiated and factually incorrect. There is no visual evidence in the image to support the claim. The external check, using Snopes, confirms the falsity of this claim, tracing its origin to a satirical website, ClickHole.  Both internal and external checks align perfectly in determining the claim is false, and there's no visual evidence contradicting this. The high confidence score of 10 reflects the strong agreement between internal analysis of the image and verifiable external information debunking the claim.

The internal check's confidence score of 10 and the external check's confidence score of 10 strongly support the conclusion that the caption is out of context.  The internal check correctly identifies the image but points out the factual inaccuracy of the claim regarding Daniel Radcliffe's ethnicity. The external check provides further corroboration by referencing Snopes's fact-check, which definitively labels the claim as false and traces it to a known source of misinformation. The alignment of internal and external findings leaves no room for doubt.  There is no ambiguity or discrepancy between the two checks.  Both provide strong evidence demonstrating the caption's falsity.  Moreover, a careful visual inspection of the image reveals nothing that would suggest Daniel Radcliffe is Chinese.  His appearance offers no visual clues supporting the claim in the caption.  The consistency between visual inspection, internal validation, and external verification leads to a high confidence level (10) in the assessment.  The caption is demonstrably false and entirely out of context regarding the provided image.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external checks strongly support the conclusion that the caption is out of context and factually inaccurate.  The claim about Daniel Radcliffe's ethnicity is false, and there is no visual evidence in the image to support it.
